When a factory burns fossil fuels, it sends carbon molecules into the atmosphere. Over time, the increase in greenhouse gases leads to climate change.

Cows release methane gas that puts carbon into the atmosphere. Over time, the increase in greenhouse gases leads to climate change.

Trees absorb carbon from the atmosphere through photosynthesis, distributing it back to the earth through their roots.
